citations.narrative:
There was one dog out of 21 that had no official form of identification on it at the time of inspection. Identification is
essential to ensure that each dog can be properly identified and to facilitate accurate record keeping and tracking. This
dog must be identified by means of an official tag affixed to a collar, legible tattoo marking approved by the Administrator,
or microchip. The licensee must ensure that each dog always has the required form of official identification. To be correct
by June 21st, 2023.

Three of the 21 dogs on hand were not listed on APHIS Form 7005. Complete records of acquisition and disposition
facilitate the inspection process and the ability to trace the movement of dogs. The licensee must ensure all required
information is properly and accurately documented for all dogs on the APHIS Form 7005.
To be corrected by: June 21st, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
There was one dog out of 21 that had no official form of identification on it at the time of inspection. Identification is 
essential to ensure that each dog can be properly identified and to facilitate accurate record keeping and tracking. This 
dog must be identified by means of an official tag affixed to a collar, legible tattoo marking approved by the Administrator, 
or microchip. The licensee must ensure that each dog always has the required form of official identification. To be correct 
by June 21st, 2023. 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Three of the 21 dogs on hand were not listed on APHIS Form 7005. Complete records of acquisition and disposition 
facilitate the inspection process and the ability to trace the movement of dogs. The licensee must ensure all required 
information is properly and accurately documented for all dogs on the APHIS Form 7005. 
To be corrected by: June 21st, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
